hints.hint: If you place a decoration next to a passenger building it generates more passengers.
The little hearts on a friends tag are called buddy points.
The WonderQuicky is more than 3 times better than the normal Rama-XS-Quicky.
You can also click on the Luggage Depot to open the lucky luggage.
Try out “All You Can Quickservice” if you know you will send a lot of planes today.
The only way to get the Rama-Falcon is by collecting plane parts in the lucky luggage.
You can get the Skyscraper only from the lucky luggage.
Check your collection from time to time to see what souvenirs you’re missing.
Every country can drop 3 different souvenirs. Fly to countries you need souvenirs from.
Small planes are ideal for collecting many souvenirs.
Hold the left mouse button to drag the map around.
Zoom in and out using the mouse wheel.
Passengers stay at your airport for just 5 days, so don't forget to send them home on time!
When you service a buddy’s cargo plane you get some of the cargo from its home country.
Cobblestone plates can be flipped, they just look the same.
Daily goals depend on your level and can be a significant booster for your progress.
To service helicopters all you need is a Helipad.
The same country will always provide wares for the same shop category.
Every second level a shop needs one additional ware to produce a better version of its products.
On its highest level a shop needs 4 wares to produce products.
High level shops are harder to manage, but the profit you gain is a lot higher as well.
If you are missing some wares you can buy them in the warehouse pop-up.
For every consecutive day you log in you get more free spins on the lucky luggage.
1930’s planes don’t bring you back coins but a lot of experience points.
Passenger buildings in storage don’t produce passengers.
Refill your shops before landing planes to maximize your revenue.
Ramacopters generate more aircoins than comparable normal planes.
As soon as you have a warehouse you can start collecting all sorts of wares by sending cargo planes.
Buildings can be rotated 90 degrees with the “Flip” tool in your storage.
All shops have specific characteristics which you can look up in the shop or storage mouse over.
You can upgrade your hangar and warehouse capacity by clicking on the building on your airport.
Completing goals can give you experience, coins, planes, passengers, buildings or building upgrades.
Many items can be bought in the shop for Aircash before you reach the necessary level.
Quickservicing can be a great timesaver when sending and servicing large planes.
Out of Aircoins or passengers? You can trade Aircash for Aircoins or passengers in the shop's “Specials” category.
Need more space for your airport? You can buy map extentions in the shop's “Specials” category.
You can buy different backgrounds in the shop's “Specials” category.
Hallow-scream through the clouds in Skyrama!
